moves.name: Mega Punch
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack move. It is highly accurate and relatively powerful.

moves.name: Razor Wind
moves.explanation: A two-turn attack with the wind attack in the second turn. Learned by many FLYING-type Pokemon.

moves.name: Sword's Dance
moves.explanation: A special move that greatly boosts the user's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to three times.

moves.name: Whirlwind
moves.explanation: Generates a powerful wind that blows away wild Pokemon. Useful in the wild only.

moves.name: Mega Kick
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Out of all the Pokemon kicking attacks, this is the strongest.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.explanation: A technique that badly poisons the target. The amount of damage from the poison increases every turn.

moves.name: Horn Drill
moves.explanation: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokemon with a horn or horns.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target if it connects.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.explanation: A charging attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

moves.name: Double Edge
moves.explanation: A charging tackle attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

moves.name: Bubble Beam
moves.explanation: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

moves.name: Water Gun
moves.explanation: A WATER-type attack. Stronger than BUBBLE. Many WATER-type Pokemon learn this move.

moves.name: Ice Beam
moves.explanation: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.explanation: The strongest ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.explanation: An extremely powerful attack. The attacker becomes so tired, it has to rest the next turn.

moves.name: Pay Day
moves.explanation: A move that also nets money at the end of battle. How much depends on the attack frequency and level.

moves.name: Submission
moves.explanation: The strongest FIGHTING attack. One quarter of the damage it inflicts comes back to hurt the attacker.

moves.name: Counter
moves.explanation: A retaliation move that pays back double the damage of a physical attack. Highly accurate.

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.explanation: A FIGHTING-type attack. Throws the target with enough force to flip the world upside down.

moves.name: Rage
moves.explanation: A non-stop attack move. The user's ATTACK power increases every time it sustains damage.

moves.name: Mega Drain
moves.explanation: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.explanation: The strongest GRASS-type attack. Energy is absorbed in the first turn, then fired the next turn.

moves.name: Dragon Rage
moves.explanation: A DRAGON-type attack. It inflicts a set amount of damage, regardless of the target's type.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.explanation: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.explanation: The strongest of all ELECTRIC-type attacks. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.explanation: An attack that inflicts damage by shaking the ground. It is useless against FLYING-type Pokemon.

moves.name: Fissure
moves.explanation: Causes a single-hit knockout if it hits. Useless against FLYING-type Pokemon.

moves.name: Dig
moves.explanation: The attacker digs underground in the first turn, then pops up in the next turn to attack.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.explanation: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's SPECIAL rating.

moves.name: Teleport
moves.explanation: A special technique for instantly escaping from wild Pokemon. Useful in the wild only.

moves.name: Mimic
moves.explanation: A move for learning one of the opponent's moves, for use during that battle only.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.explanation: Creates illusionary copies of the user. The copies disorient the enemy, reducing its accuracy.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.explanation: Reduces damage from physical attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type technique.

moves.name: Bide
moves.explanation: The user waits for several turns. At the end, it returns double the damage it received.

moves.name: Metronome
moves.explanation: The user waggles its finger, triggering a move. There is no telling what will happen.

moves.name: SelfDestruct
moves.explanation: The user explodes, inflicting damage on the enemy, then faints. Useless against GHOST-type.

moves.name: Egg Bomb
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. An egg is launched at the target. It may miss, however.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.explanation: The strongest FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

moves.name: Swift
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. It is highly accurate, so it can be counted on to inflict damage.

moves.name: Skull Bash
moves.explanation: In the first turn, the attacker tucks in its head. The next turn, it head-butts at full steam.

moves.name: Softboiled
moves.explanation: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. May also be used in the field.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.explanation: Works only on sleeping Pokemon. This technique steals the target's HP and adds it to the user's HP.

moves.name: Sky Attack
moves.explanation: The strongest FLYING-type attack. Energy is stored in the first turn, then fired the next turn.

moves.name: Rest
moves.explanation: The user takes a nap to fully restore its HP and recover from any status abnormalities.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.explanation: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.

moves.name: Psywave
moves.explanation: A PSYCHIC-type attack of varying intensity. It occasionally inflicts  heavy damage.

moves.name: Explosion
moves.explanation: The most powerful attack of all. However, the attacker faints after using this move.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.explanation: A ROCK-type attack that hits the target with an avalanche of rocks and boulders.

moves.name: Tri Attack
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. A triangular field of energy is created and launched at the target.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.explanation: Uses 1/4 of the user's maximum HP to create a substitute that takes the opponent's attacks.

moves.name: Cut
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Also used for cutting small bushes to open new paths.

moves.name: Fly
moves.explanation: The Pokemon flies high, then strikes in the next turn. Used for flying to places already visited.

moves.name: Surf
moves.explanation: A WATER-type attack. The power of this technique is strong and highly accurate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.explanation: A very powerful NORMAL-type attack. Also used for moving obstacles like boulders.

moves.name: Flash
moves.explanation: Creates a brilliant flash of light that blinds the target. This technique reduces the opponent's accuracy.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Many Pokemon know this attack right from the start.

moves.name: Growl
moves.explanation: A technique that lowers the target's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

moves.name: Leech Seed
moves.explanation: Plants a seed on the target Pokemon. The seed slowly drains the target's HP for the attacker.

moves.name: Vine Whip
moves.explanation: A GRASS-type attack. The Pokemon uses its cruel whips to strike the opponent.

moves.name: Poison Powder
moves.explanation: A technique that poisons the target. If poisoned, the victim loses HP steadily.

moves.name: Razor Leaf
moves.explanation: A GRASS-type attack that sends sharp-edged leaves at the target. Likely to get a critical hit.

moves.name: Growth
moves.explanation: Raises SPECIAL to make special attacks stronger and enhance protection against special moves.

moves.name: Sleep Powder
moves.explanation: Induces sleep. A Pokemon will stay asleep for several turns if an item isn't used to wake it.

moves.name: Scratch
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Sharp claws are used to inflict damage on the target.

moves.name: Ember
moves.explanation: A FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target with a damaging burn.

moves.name: Leer
moves.explanation: A technique that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokemon.

moves.name: Slash
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. It has a high probability of a critical hit for inflicting double the damage.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.explanation: A powerful FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target with a damaging burn.

moves.name: Fire Spin
moves.explanation: A FIRE-type attack that lasts two to five turns. The target cannot move while surrounded by flames.

moves.name: Tail Whip
moves.explanation: A technique that lowers the target's DEFENSE. Useful against tough, armored Pokemon.

moves.name: Bubble
moves.explanation: A WATER-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

moves.name: Bite
moves.explanation: A bite made using sharp fangs. This may cause the opponent to flinch, and it might not attack.

moves.name: Withdraw
moves.explanation: Used mainly by Pokemon with shells. By withdrawing into the shell, DEFENSE is increased.

moves.name: Hydro Pump
moves.explanation: The strongest WATER-type attack. However, while it is powerful, it may miss the target.

moves.name: String Shot
moves.explanation: Strings are sprayed out and wrapped around the target to reduce its SPEED.

moves.name: Harden
moves.explanation: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Useful when battling physically strong Pokemon.

moves.name: Confusion
moves.explanation: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of leaving the target confused.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.explanation: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.explanation: A special NORMAL-type technique. Supersonic sound waves are used to confuse the target.

moves.name: Gust
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack used by bird Pokemon. A powerful wind is generated by flapping wings.

moves.name: Psybeam
moves.explanation: A PSYCHIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target confused.

moves.name: Poison Sting
moves.explanation: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in- five chance of leaving the target  with the lingering effects of poison.

moves.name: Fury Attack
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. The Pokemon rapidly jabs at its opponent several times.

moves.name: Focus Energy
moves.explanation: Raises the likelihood of nailing the opponent's weak spot for a critical hit.

moves.name: Twineedle
moves.explanation: An attack that strikes twice. The target may occasionally become poisoned.

moves.name: Pin Missile
moves.explanation: An attack that fires many needle-like projectiles from the body. Strikes several times.

moves.name: Agility
moves.explanation: A special technique that greatly boosts the user's SPEED. Can normally be used up to three times.

moves.name: Sand-Attack
moves.explanation: An attack in which sand is used to blind the target and reduce its attack accuracy.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.explanation: An attack that always strikes first. If both Pokemon use this, the one with higher SPEED attacks first.

moves.name: Wing Attack
moves.explanation: A FLYING-type attack. The attacking Pokemon spreads its wings and charges at the target.

moves.name: Mirror Move
moves.explanation: A move that strikes back with the opponent's last move. This move comes after the enemy's move.

moves.name: Hyper Fang
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of making the target flinch.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.explanation: If it hits, this attack cuts the target's HP in half. Learned by Pokemon with developed fangs.

moves.name: Peck
moves.explanation: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is favored by Pokemon that have beaks and/or horns.

moves.name: Drill Peck
moves.explanation: A standard FLYING-type attack. It is strong and highly likely to hit the target.

moves.name: Wrap
moves.explanation: Traps and squeezes the target over two to five turns. The target cannot move while under attack.

moves.name: Glare
moves.explanation: The target is transfixed with terrifying sharp eyes. The target is frightened into paralysis.

moves.name: Screech
moves.explanation: A move that makes a horrible noise. It sharply reduces the target's DEFENSE.

moves.name: Acid
moves.explanation: A POISON-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's DEFENSE.

moves.name: Thunder Shock
moves.explanation: An ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

moves.name: Slam
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack move. The attacker uses an appendage (e.g. tail) to slam the target hard.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.explanation: Reduces damage from special attacks by about half. A special PSYCHIC-type technique.

moves.name: Fury Swipes
moves.explanation: The target is scratched by sharp claws two to five times in quick succession.

moves.name: Double Kick
moves.explanation: A FIGHTING-type attack. As the name implies, it is actually two quick kicks in succession.

moves.name: Horn Attack
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. A sharp horn is driven hard into the target to inflict damage.

moves.name: Thrash
moves.explanation: An attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker becomes confused.

moves.name: Pound
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Slightly stronger than TACKLE. Many Pokemon know this move.

moves.name: Sing
moves.explanation: A special NORMAL-type technique. A soothing melody lulls the target to sleep.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.explanation: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

moves.name: Minimize
moves.explanation: Reduces the user's size and makes it harder to hit. Can normally be used up to six times.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.explanation: Raises the user's DEFENSE. Can normally be used up to six times in a row.

moves.name: Roar
moves.explanation: A terrifying roar that drives wild Pokemon away. It is useful only in the wild.

moves.name: Confuse Ray
moves.explanation: A sinister flash of light makes the target confused. A special GHOST-type technique.

moves.name: Disable
moves.explanation: A technique that disables one of the target's moves. The disabled move can't be used until it wears off.

moves.name: Leech Life
moves.explanation: An HP-draining attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

moves.name: Haze
moves.explanation: Eliminates all changes affecting status, such as SPEED and accuracy, of both Pokemon in battle.

moves.name: Absorb
moves.explanation: A GRASS-type attack. It adds half the HP it drained from the target to the attacker's HP.

moves.name: Petal Dance
moves.explanation: A dance-like attack that lasts two to three turns. Afterwards, the attacker becomes confused.

moves.name: Spore
moves.explanation: Special spores are scattered from mushrooms. If the opponent inhales the spores, it will fall asleep.

moves.name: Low Kick
moves.explanation: A FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

moves.name: Karate Chop
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Often turns into a critical hit and inflicts double the damage.

moves.name: Hypnosis
moves.explanation: A special PSYCHIC-type move. The target is hypnotized into a deep sleep.

moves.name: Amnesia
moves.explanation: Sharply raises the user's SPECIAL stat. Also increases protection against special attacks.

moves.name: Kinesis
moves.explanation: A special move of bending spoons to confound the enemy. Makes the user harder to hit.

moves.name: Recover
moves.explanation: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. Few Pokemon learn this technique on their own.

moves.name: Constrict
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's SPEED.

moves.name: Barrier
moves.explanation: Instantly forms a barrier between the user and the opponent. DEFENSE is sharply increased.

moves.name: Rock Throw
moves.explanation: A ROCK-type attack. As the name implies, a huge boulder is dropped on the target.

moves.name: Stomp
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

moves.name: Sonic Boom
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. It inflicts a set amount of damage regardless of the target's type.

moves.name: Aurora Beam
moves.explanation: An ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of reducing the target's ATTACK power.

moves.name: Poison Gas
moves.explanation: A poisonous cloud of gas is forcefully expelled to poison the target.

moves.name: Sludge
moves.explanation: A POISON-type attack. Has a fifty-fifty chance of poisoning the target.

moves.name: Acid Armor
moves.explanation: Melts the user's body for protection. A move that sharply raises DEFENSE.

moves.name: Clamp
moves.explanation: The target is gripped in the attacker's shell for two to five turns. It can't move while under attack.

moves.name: Spike Cannon
moves.explanation: A physical attack consisting of two to five consecutive hits. Highly accurate.

moves.name: Lick
moves.explanation: A GHOST-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of leaving the target with paralysis.

moves.name: Night Shade
moves.explanation: A GHOST-type attack. Highly accurate, it inflicts damage regardless of the target's type.

moves.name: Bind
moves.explanation: Traps and squeezes the target over several turns. The target cannot move while under attack.

moves.name: Meditate
moves.explanation: A special technique that boosts the user's ATTACK power. Can normally be used up to six times.

moves.name: Vice Grip
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack used only by Pokemon with pincers. The target is gripped and injured.

moves.name: Guillotine
moves.explanation: A single-hit knockout attack. Learned only by Pokemon that have large pincers.

moves.name: Crabhammer
moves.explanation: A move that is used only by Pokemon with pincers. Likely to get a critical hit.

moves.name: Barrage
moves.explanation: Several spheres are thrown consecutively at the target to inflict damage.

moves.name: Bone Club
moves.explanation: A physical attack using a bone as a club. If it connects, it may cause the target to flinch.

moves.name: Bonemerang
moves.explanation: A boomerang made of bone is thrown to inflict damage twice -- on the way out and on its return.

moves.name: Rolling Kick
moves.explanation: A sharp FIGHTING-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of making the target flinch if it connects.

moves.name: Jump Kick
moves.explanation: A forceful FIGHTING-type attack. If it misses, however, the attacker gets hurt.

moves.name: Hi Jump Kick
moves.explanation: Stronger than a JUMP KICK. If it misses, the attacker sustains 1/8 the damage it should have caused.

moves.name: Comet Punch
moves.explanation: Although each slap is weak, this attack hits the target two to five times in succession.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.explanation: A special FIRE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of inflicting a burn on the target.

moves.name: Ice Punch
moves.explanation: A special ICE-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.explanation: A special ELECTRIC-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.

moves.name: Smog
moves.explanation: Smog is spewed as a cloud. Has a fifty-fifty chance of poisoning the target.

moves.name: Smokescreen
moves.explanation: Creates an obscuring cloud of smoke that reduces the enemy's accuracy.

moves.name: Dizzy Punch
moves.explanation: A NORMAL-type attack. The punch is relatively strong and highly accurate.

moves.name: Waterfall
moves.explanation: A WATER-type attack. The target is hit with a blow packing the power of fish traveling up waterfalls.

moves.name: Lovely Kiss
moves.explanation: A special move that puts the target to sleep with a big kiss. (Actually, the victim passes out.)

moves.name: Splash
moves.explanation: A move that involves only flopping and SPLASHing around in front of the opponent. It has no effect.

moves.name: Mist
moves.explanation: Provides full protection against any enemy status attack, such as those that lower DEFENSE.

moves.name: Transform
moves.explanation: Transforms the user into a copy of the target, including the type. All moves have only five PP each.

moves.name: Sharpen
moves.explanation: Raises the user's ATTACK power. The edges of the Pokemon are made harder for more impact.

moves.name: Conversion
moves.explanation: A special move that switches the user's elemental type to that of the target.
